entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Degree)
fields.briefDescription: Saksham is a Scholarship Scheme by the Ministry of Education, implemented by AICTE, aimed at providing encouragement and support to specially-abled children to pursue technical education. This is an attempt to give every young specially-abled student the opportunity to study further.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
fields.schemeName: Financial Support To The Students Of N.E.R For Higher Professional Courses (NEC Merit Scholarship)
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the North Eastern Council (NEC), Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region for the students of the North Eastern States undergoing studies in different disciplines at different levels in Institutions inside as well as outside the North-East but within the country.

fields.schemeName: AICTE-Swanath Scholarship Scheme For Students
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Student Development Cell (StDC) of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to provide encouragement and support to orphans, wards of parents who died due to Covid-19, wards of Armed Forces, and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed).

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance For Procuring Mobility Equipment To Disabled Ex-Servicemen (All Ranks)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance of a maximum of ₹ 1,00,000 from the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund (AFFDF) for the procurement of modified scooters, crutches and wheelchairs for Ex-Servicemen who are disabled after their retirement from service with a disability of 50% or more.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Overseas Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students with disabilities to obtain higher education viz., Master's degree, or Ph.D. courses from foreign universities, in one of the specified fields of study.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: NDRI Institute Scholarship For M.Sc. And Ph.d
fields.briefDescription: “Institute Scholarship” is offered to all students of Indian Nationality admitted to Master’s and Doctoral programmes at NDRI to provide them with financial assistance.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: ICAR Emeritus Professor
fields.briefDescription: The ICAR floated the Scheme of Emeritus Professor in order to provide an opportunity to the superannuated teachers/ Scientists of universities, colleges and institutions under ICAR-AU System.

fields.schemeName: Central Assistance For One Time Settlement Of Displaced Families From PoK And Chhamb Under Prime Minister's Development Package
fields.briefDescription: A relief and rehabilitation scheme by the Ministry of Home Affairs provides central assistance to the displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir. The amount of Central Assistance of Rs. 5,49,692/- per family will be distributed through Direct Benefit Transfer.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: IASRI Scholarship For M.Sc And Ph.D
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Agricultural Statistics Research Institute is a premier Institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research for conducting research and education in the field of agricultural statistics and computer application in agriculture.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Scheme For Medical Equipment And Accessories, Medical Diagnostics And Ayush Products Manufacturing Units
fields.briefDescription: “Scheme For Medical Equipment And Accessories, Medical Diagnostics And Ayush Products Manufacturing Units'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, by the Dept. of Industries, DNH & DD, aims to provide subsidy to Medical Equipment and AYUSH Products Manufacturing Units.

fields.schemeName: Creation of Modern Facilities in Market Committee: Scheme to provide assistance foe setting up modern facilities in Market Committee
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to Market Committees for setting up modern facilities, improving agricultural infrastructure, and enhancing the competitiveness of agricultural markets.

fields.schemeName: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for the care of mentally retarded children (son/daughter) of construction workers.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Distribution of Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Distribution of Female Menstrual Hygiene Kit for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides Menstrual Hygiene Kit to registered female beneficiaries.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance and Wage Loss for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Medical Assistance and Wage Loss for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, U.T. of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides medical expenses for injuries sustained during employment and will pay half-monthly wages during the period of disablement to the eligible worker.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Self Education for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Skill Development for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides reimbursement of the course fees for distance education from and an incentive for each degree.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Payment of Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Payment of Funeral Assistance for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for funeral expenses to the nominees/ dependents of a deceased registered member or their spouse.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Grant of Token Amount for Construction of House for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Grant of Token Amount for Construction of House for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the eligible registered member for construction of house.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Financial assistance for Marriage for the Construction Worker
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Marriage for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for marriage of self and for children (upto 2 children) of the building workers.

fields.schemeName: Economic Help To Sahariya Tribal Girl Students (Class 11 And 12)
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan Government started a scholarship for Sahariya tribal girls' higher education (Class 11 and 12).

fields.schemeName: Hamaal Hetu Joota, Huk Evan Mahila Hamaal Hetu Soopa Aur Tokari Sahaayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Hamaal Hetu Joota, Huk Evan Mahila Hamaal Hetu Soopa Aur Tokari Sahaayata Yojana" for unorganized worker on 11 March 2015.

fields.schemeName: Vishesh Yogyajan Chhatravriti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, scholarships and tuition fee reimbursement are provided to specially-abled students belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹2.00 lakh, who are regularly studying in government and recognized educational institutions.

fields.schemeName: Kisan Parivahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for purchasing medium-sized goods vehicles to facilitate the transportation of agricultural produce.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister EBC Civil Seva Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Bihar Government provides incentives to individuals belonging to the EBC Categories upon passing the preliminary examination of various competitive exams such as UPSC, BPSC, NDA, CDS, Banking, Railway, SSC, etc., to support their further preparation for the main examination/interview.

fields.schemeName: Promoting to Farmer for Post Harvesting & Management (Value Addition)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to support farmers in setting up crop value addition units using post-harvesting technology and management concepts.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance On Marriage Of Children (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance on Marriage of Children (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Ashadeepa Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was introduced by the Government of Karnataka in the 2017-18 budget to encourage private sector industries and companies to provide employment opportunities to persons belonging to the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe categories, ensuring social justice.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers to Increase the Area, Production and Productivity of Sugarcane Farming
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to SC farmers to increase sugarcane production and productivity through quality seeds, modern farming practices, and agricultural mechanization.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Digitization of Business Processes and Adoption of eCommerce
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers MSMEs up to 75% reimbursement (max ₹50,000) for software/equipment costs for digitization, plus 75% of e-commerce platform fees (excl. shipping), also up to ₹50,000. Reimbursement is allowed for one e-commerce platform per MSME only.

fields.schemeName: Samman Bhatta to War Widows and Parents of Martyrs
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per month to war widows and parents of unmarried martyrs who sacrificed their lives in various wars, counter-insurgency operations, and aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999.

fields.schemeName: Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme" by the BC & EBC Welfare Department, Bihar provides hostel facilities for students near Saharsa District with food grains (9 kg rice, 6 kg wheat) and ₹1000/- per month as a grant.

fields.schemeName: Post Matric Scholarship for SC students (Delhi)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Post Matric Scholarship for SC Students" aims to support SC students financially for post-matriculation studies. Benefits include fee reimbursement and monthly allowances. Intended beneficiaries are SC students with a family income below ₹2,50,000/- annually.

fields.schemeName: World War II Pension
fields.briefDescription: The aim of the scheme is to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹15,000/- per month as a measure of relief to World War II ex-servicemen and their widows who are not receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source.

fields.schemeName: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to enhance fish seed production and promote inland fisheries in non-tribal areas.

fields.schemeName: Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support the families of Gujarat's active fishermen by offering monetary compensation in case of accidental fatalities.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to enhance fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals engaged in inland fisheries.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competition Scheme for Class 10th-12th & Colleges/Universities/Institutions Students in 22 Indian Languages and English
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage school, college & university students of 10th and 12th standards to write on the contribution of Babasaheb, particularly on his thoughts on social justice, empowerment of the depressed section, removal of caste-based discriminations, national integration, etc.

fields.schemeName: Intensive Castration Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Intensive Castration Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to control the stray animal population by castrating male calves and helps in reducing accidents caused by stray male animals in rural and urban areas.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Assistance to MSMEs for Market Development
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to MSMEs participating in national and international fairs/exhibitions/buyer-seller meets, etc., under the Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024.

fields.schemeName: Providing Navigational Aids and Other Infrastructure Facilities
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to support fishermen by providing financial assistance for purchasing essential fishing equipment, life-saving gear, and infrastructure to enhance safety, efficiency, and fish preservation.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship/Merit Scholarship Schools SC/ST/OBC/Min (Studying in College/Technical/ Professional Institutions)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides monthly financial aid to SC/ST/OBC/Minority students pursuing higher education. Benefits include scholarships for hostellers and day scholars, with eligibility based on academic performance and income criteria.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to offer monetary aid to fishermen who use kerosene or petrol for their small boats operated by OBM.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Bird’s unit 40 R.I.R. Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance and training to economically weaker sections and Divyang individuals in Gujarat for poultry farming.

fields.schemeName: Bhed Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among marginalized communities through sustainable sheep rearing practices. Through this scheme, a sheep-rearing unit consisting of 10 female sheep and 1 male sheep (aged between 10 to 14 months) is provided to eligible beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's Micro Finance Initiative
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote access to credit for economic activities undertaken by individual farmers, entrepreneurs, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) in the state of Nagaland.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Asahaya Punarwas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and rehabilitation support to destitute individuals who are orphaned, abandoned by their parents, or have no one to care for them. Beneficiaries receive one-time financial aid and support for admission to day-care centers or old-age homes.

fields.schemeName: Valmiki Chhatravritti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Valmiki Chhatravritti Yojana" by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide financial assistance and encouragement to orphaned and differently-abled students to pursue higher education and benefits include full tuition fee reimbursement.

fields.schemeName: BPL (Below Poverty Line) Student Welfare Scholarship - Technical Education
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the form of scholarships to the economically weaker students studying in government engineering and polytechnic colleges of Chhattisgarh.  The scheme offers financial aid to students enrolled in professional courses.

fields.schemeName: Tiatr Competition
fields.briefDescription: The "Tiatr Competition" aims to encourage and promote the unique Goan theatre form of Tiatr. Participation in this scheme is open to Goan institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (with renewed registration). Entries are invited through press notes in local dailies.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to General Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

fields.schemeName: Gau Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote cow rearing by providing financial support for the purchase of a milch cow. Through this scheme, a subsidy of ₹36,000 is given to SECC beneficiaries from SC/ST communities.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Bakri Palan
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of up to ₹35,000/- is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries (Abandoned, widowed, destitute, single, and disaster-affected women) for the purchase of one unit of goats (comprising 3 females and 1 male), aged between 12 to 18 months.

fields.schemeName: To Provide Financial Assistance to the Farmers Practicing Natural Farming Under the Completely Chemical Free Dang District
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance to farmers practicing natural farming in the completely chemical-free Dang district to promote sustainable agriculture, increase productivity, and ensure environmental conservation.

fields.schemeName: Scheme on Promotion of Use of Liquid Fermented Organic Manure (LFOM) for Increasing Organic Carbon in Soil
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme on Promotion of Use of Liquid Fermented Organic Manure (LFOM) for Increasing Organic Carbon in Soil" offers financial assistance to promote the use of Liquid Fermented Organic Manure (LFOM) and enhance organic carbon levels in soil.

fields.schemeName: Rajasthan Varishth Patrakar Samman Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to full-time accredited journalists who are 60 years of age or older & have served continuously for at least 20 years in daily, weekly, fortnightly newspapers, independent publications, electronic media, or news agencies.

fields.schemeName: Free Computer Training
fields.briefDescription: “Free Computer Training” is a social security scheme that provides free of cost computer training to widows, dependents of the ex-servicemen and soldiers.

fields.schemeName: Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)" provides financial assistance for the construction of Dudhghar (milk storage unit) and Godown (cattle feed storage) for Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies in Scheduled Caste areas of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Assistance for Management of Stray Cattle
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial support to local self-government bodies and registered Panjrapoles to reduce or eradicate the problem of stray cattle by encouraging their maintenance and proper care.

fields.schemeName: National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)" is a social welfare scheme by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. Under this scheme, ₹20,000/-. is provided to the family in the event of the death of their primary breadwinner.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Rajya Bridhhabasta Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: “Mukhyamantri Rajya Bridhhabasta Pension Yojana” is a Social Security Scheme by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme provides financial asistance to the age group of 60 years and above.

fields.schemeName: Special Financial Assistance Scheme for Meritorious Students of the State for Preparation of Competitive Examinations
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support of ₹50,000/- to meritorious students who have cleared the preliminary examination conducted by the State or Union Public Service Commission for Group 'A' and 'B' services, or the written examination for the Armed Forces (e.g., NDA, CDS, OTA, etc.).

fields.schemeName: ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR) offers Doctoral Fellowships to support full-time Ph.D. scholars engaged in high-quality research in the field of social and human sciences. These fellowships are awarded to Indian research scholars registered in Ph.D. programs at UGC-recognized u

fields.schemeName: Award Scheme for Candidates Selected in NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, IAF
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a one-time award of ₹50,000/- is given to each candidate from Uttarakhand who has been selected for service at premier defence academies such as the NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, and IAF, and is either undergoing training or has been formally inducted into service.

fields.schemeName: Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-reliance in the agriculture sector through sustainable plantation activities across the state. Under this scheme, support in the form of plantation assistance and allied resources is provided to individual farmers, Self-Help Groups & Farmer Producer Organizations.

fields.schemeName: Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme
fields.briefDescription: “Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme” is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides interest-free loans for higher education and overseas studies to the  minority students.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Adhikarita Yojana (Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation)
fields.briefDescription: "Mahila Adhikarita Yojana" introduced by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, is a centrally sponsored financial support scheme offering loans of ₹20,000/- at a subsidized interest rate to women sweepers and their dependents to promote self-reliance and upliftment.

fields.schemeName: Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, every year, 25 artisans of Uttarakhand are honored. The award includes a cash prize of ₹1,00,000, a certificate of appreciation, a memento, an angavastra (ceremonial stole), and a citation letter.

fields.schemeName: Palak Mata-Pita Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Palak Mata-Pita Yojana" introduced on 29th August, 2009 by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides a monthly assistance of ₹3000 to foster parents raising orphaned children or children whose mother has remarried after the father's death.

fields.schemeName: Atma Nirbhar Pashu Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to enhance rural livelihoods, promote sustainable animal husbandry practices, & contribute to self-reliance in livestock sector. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to unemployed individuals, SHGs, cooperative societies, etc. for livestock rearing & allied activities.

fields.schemeName: Hostel Rent Assistance Scheme for Tribal Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance towards hostel rent for Scheduled Tribe students pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate courses in government colleges, who are staying in rented accommodation for the purpose of regular studies.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister's Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote high-quality, interdisciplinary research in higher education institutions across the state. Under this scheme, a one-time research grant of up to ₹15 lakhs (extendable to ₹18 Lakhs in special cases) is provided, alongwith a monthly stipend of ₹5,000 for research assistant.

fields.schemeName: Assistance Program for the Cultivation of Lotus Fruit (Dragon Fruit)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers to support the cultivation of dragon fruit (lotus fruit), with higher benefits for SC/ST and priority for small-scale and women farmers.

fields.schemeName: Family Pension for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: “Family Pension for the Construction Workers’’ is a social security scheme that provides monthly pension of ₹500/- per month or 50% of the pensioner's pension whichever is higher to the spouse of the registered worker, who is a pensioner in case of death of the construction worker.

fields.schemeName: Construction of Water Storage Tanks for Drip Irrigation
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers across Gujarat for constructing water storage tanks to support drip irrigation, with cost-sharing benefits based on farmer category.

fields.schemeName: Antyeshthi Sahay Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Antyeshthi Sahay Yojana" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides financial assistance of ₹5,000 to the heir of a deceased senior citizen who was receiving old age assistance.

fields.schemeName: Nikshay Poshan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India has announced the scheme for incentives for nutritional support to TB patients. This scheme will be called “Nikshay Poshan Yojana”.

fields.schemeName: Operation of Sports Hostels
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage tribal students to participate in sports and prepare them for national & international competitions. Tribal students from Classes 6 to 12 are provided with free accommodation, specialized training, nutritious meals & other necessary facilities in the sports hostels.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Skill Development" by the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology, aims to impart practical training to postgraduate students in various Earth Science disciplines, including structural and evolutionary geology, geochemistry, geomorphology, glaciology, magnetostratigraphy, etc.

fields.schemeName: Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe) Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe communities through fishery-based diversified activities. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided to eligible fish farmers for pond renovation & integrated fish farming (duck/poultry/fruit plantation).

fields.schemeName: Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote sustainable fish farming through cluster-based pond development. It provides 50% subsidy for pond construction and first-year inputs to eligible individuals and groups.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Chhatravritti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri Chhatravritti Yojana" is a scholarship scheme for NCC cadets who have cleared 10th or 12th standard, completed two years of NCC training with 80% attendance, and are pursuing higher education.

fields.schemeName: Stand-Up India
fields.briefDescription: A scheme by Ministry of Finance for financing SC/ST and  Women Entrepreneurs by facilitating bank loans for setting up a greenfield project  Enterprise in manufacturing, services, trading sector and activities allied to agriculture.

fields.schemeName: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Disabled)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-reliance among persons with disabilities through grants, term loans, and margin money assistance.

fields.schemeName: Accessibility Services to Disabled People
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Accessibility Services to Disabled People" aims to provide suitable employment opportunities to unemployed visually impaired and low vision individuals. Through this scheme, assistance is provided in securing placements in the public and private sectors.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-yojana (PM-MKSSY): COMPONENT 1B: One-Time Incentive for the Adoption of Aquaculture Insurance
fields.briefDescription: The Component 1B of PM-MKSSY provides a one-time incentive to eligible applicants who have availed institutional credit for fisheries-related activities. The objective is to encourage formal credit adoption and support the repayment capacity of fisheries microenterprises.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister State Livestock Mission: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-employment at the local level by offering interest subsidies on bank loans for setting up various livestock units. Under this scheme, residents of Uttarakhand are eligible for a 90% interest subsidy on loans taken for the purchase of livestock.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Nursery Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote nursery establishment by providing women's groups with high-quality seedlings or saplings from certified sources, along with a fixed grant, technical support, and training to ensure effective nursery operations.

fields.schemeName: E-Rickshaw Kalyan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme focuses on providing financial assistance and incentives to individuals and entrepreneurs who wish to operate electric rickshaws in urban and semi-urban areas. The primary objective is to reduce air pollution, promote cleaner transportation, and generate employment opportunities.

fields.schemeName: Uttarakhand Unn Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide spinning and weaving work, fostering employment in the wool industry. Through this scheme, payment for spinning and weaving work, along with pension benefits and an annual bonus, is provided to weavers.

fields.schemeName: Goat Valley Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to establish Goat Valleys as clusters for organized goat rearing, promote youth self-employment, transform traditional goat rearing into profit-oriented enterprises, and organize the sector to enhance year-round livelihood opportunities for farmers.

fields.schemeName: Kailash Darshan Yatra
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra. To be eligible, the applicant must be a selected pilgrim from Gujarat and submit proof of yatra completion within 90 days. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline.

fields.schemeName: Our Tree Our Wealth Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote tree plantation on private land by providing an incentive of ₹300 per plant, which is disbursed after three years based on the survival rate of the plants. Each applicant or family is eligible for support for up to 100 plants per year.

fields.schemeName: Deployment of Prantiya Rakshak Dal (PRD) Volunteers
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, PRD volunteers deployed to assist the police and serve in various government offices receive a daily honorarium. In cases of death, disability, or injury occurring during duty, financial assistance is provided to their legal dependents based on the nature and severity of incident.

fields.schemeName: Rural Sports and Health Promotion Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme promotes fitness among rural youth by providing financial assistance to the mangal dals for setting up open gyms in each Gram Panchayat.

fields.schemeName: State Food Yojana (Yellow Ration Card)
fields.briefDescription: "State Food Yojana (Yellow Ration Card)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department Of Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides food per month at a nominal rate to the yellow ration card holder of the state.

fields.schemeName: Sanskrit Research Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides an annual scholarship of ₹40,000/- for up to three years to selected students pursuing Ph.D. research in Sanskrit.

fields.schemeName: PM POSHAN - Prime Minister's Overarching Scheme For Holistic Nourishment
fields.briefDescription: PM POSHAN is a centrally sponsored scheme by the Department of School Education & Literacy, Ministry of Education. Under this scheme, one hot cooked meal will be provided to the children studying in Government and Government – aided schools. The Scheme is implemented by the Ministry of Education.

fields.schemeName: National Centre For Communication Security (NCCS) Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The National Centre for Communication Security (NCCS) Internship Scheme allows young talent to be associated with the NCCS work for mutual benefit. It will enable NCCS to interact with young scholars and to get fresh ideas and study/ research support from the field of academics.

fields.schemeName: Jute Resource-Cum-Production Centre
fields.briefDescription: Jute Resource-Cum-Production Centre (JRCPC) will be set up in the local clusters and localities across the country in collaboration with bonafide Agencies who have adequate experience in training and skilling programs and have required training cum-production infrastructure.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Establishment of large RAS / Biofloc culture system - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides capital assistance for setting up large-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc culture systems to promote high-yield, sustainable fish farming.
